thread.title: Jeff Stark, East Bay Women and Finance Specialist, Hosts “Savvy Social Security Planning” Workshop for Women age 58-66 on
thread.title_full: Jeff Stark, East Bay Women and Finance Specialist, Hosts “Savvy Social Security Planning” Workshop for Women age 58-66 on

author: prbuzz.com
title: Jeff Stark, East Bay Women and Finance Specialist, Hosts “Savvy Social Security Planning” Workshop for Women age 58-66 on
text:
October 12, 2015, Lafayette, CA Financial Planner and Women Certified, winner of the 2015 Women’s Choice Award, is hosting two Financial Planning workshops on Social Security for Women in the East Bay. There are two upcoming workshops to be held October 20th in Lafayette, CA and October 22nd in Walnut Creek, CA.
Deciding when and how to claim Social Security benefits is one of the most critical decisions an individual or a couple will ever make, especially for women. Women generally live longer than men and are more dependent on Social Security for their financial well-being in their later years, according to Slate. By age 85, almost two-thirds of Social Security recipients are women. The right claiming decision can potentially boost lifetime retirement income by tens of thousands of dollars. However, many women (and couples) fail to maximize their benefits because they don’t understand the little-known rules that can help them get more out of the system.
 Who should attend? Women, between the ages of 58-66, who are single, married, divorced, or widowed, and men who have women in their lives (wives, sisters, mothers).
This workshop features the essential information all women need to know who are concerned about financial security in retirement. There are two dates and locations:
Tuesday October 20
5:30-7:00 pm
Lafayette Library
Arts & Science Discovery Center
3491 Mt Diablo Blvd, Lafayette CA
*light dinner provided
Thursday October 22
5:30-7:00 pm
Gardens at Heather Farms
Rotary Room
1540 Marchbanks Dr, Walnut Creek, CA
*light dinner provided
This Workshop focuses on Women’s financial needs. The focus on women is a part of Jeff Starks commitment to empowering women and focusing on their unique needs. As part of Jeff’s commitment to women’s issues, Jeff proudly received the Women’s Choice Award. The Women’s Choice Award was created by Delia Passi, the leading advocate for female consumers and former group publisher of Working Woman and Working Mother magazines. Delia created the Women’s Choice Award for Financial Advisors in an effort to help women identify those advisors who are committed to providing quality service. The award allows this outstanding group of advisors to showcase their commitment to the women’s market, while giving potential clients a starting point for entrusting their finances to an advisor.
As the financial industry wakes up to the fact that a great majority of the female population are seeking advisors they can trust and greatly value financial security, WomenCertified Inc. has created the solution. This powerful, national initiative distinguishes advisors who support female consumers in their quest for financial education.
Media Inquiries:
Jeffrey M. Stark, CFP®
Financial Advisor
Member FINRA/SIPC
This email address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it.
925-283-2733
###
ABOUT FIRM/ADVISOR
Jeffrey M. Stark, CFP® is a Financial Advisor with LPL Financial. His office is in Lafayette, California and serves the greater San Francisco Bay Area. Jeff is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNERTM professional and has been helping clients with money matters for over 35 years, and specializes in retirement planning.
Jeff’s goal is to help his clients in every aspect of their financial lives, especially working toward a comfortable and secure retirement.
His services include financial planning, retirement planning, lifetime income strategies, investment management, life and long-term care insurance analysis and planning, social security claiming strategies, estate planning, educational workshops for women, planning for women in transition as a result of death, divorce or career change, college expense planning, charitable remainder trust strategies, and is a workshop presenter and guest speaker to various groups and organizations.
He is currently conducting workshops on “The 10 Things Every Women Should Know About Her Finances”, “Savvy Social Security Planning for Women”, and “Taking Control – Financial Strategies for Women”. Please contact Jeff if you would like him to be a speaker at your next event.
Jeff is a member of the East Bay Chapter of the Financial Planning Association, the Estate Planning Council of Diablo Valley, and actively involved in the Lafayette Chamber of Commerce, the Walnut Creek Chamber of Commerce, and the annual East Bay Women’s Conference.
Jeff received his BA degree from Muskingum University in New Concord Ohio. He studied at the University of Munich in Munich Germany during his junior year, and graduated from Muskingum with honors. Jeff also received an MBA degree from Indiana University in Bloomington Indiana, before moving to California in 1972. Since the mid-1970’s Jeff’s career has been focused on helping people towards achieving their financial goals.
ABOUT WOMEN’S CHOICE AWARD
The Women’s Choice Award Financial Advisor Program is based on 17 objective criteria associated with providing quality service to women clients such as credentials, experience and a favorable regulatory history, among other factors. Financial advisors do not pay a fee to be considered or placed on the final list of Women’s Choice Award® Financial Advisors, though they may have paid a fee to participate in the Women’s Choice Award Financial Advisor Marketing Program. WomenCertified Inc., home to the Women’s Choice Award, awards businesses, brands and services based on high recommendation ratings by female consumers. The Women’s Choice Award represents the collective voice of women so they can help each other identify businesses that deserve their loyalty and referrals. To learn more, visit www.womenschoiceaward.com.
** 14th Annual Transamerica Retirement Survey of Workers (2014)
***Source: Harnessing the Power of the Purse, by the Center for Talent Innovation 2014
****Source: Financial Experience &Behaviors Among Women, 2010−2011 Prudential Research Study (article breaking it down here).
